tool.name: MeasureGranularity
tool.description: output spectra of size measurements of the textures

configfiles.configfile:
import json import sys import os
FOURSPACES=@SPACES@
input_json_path = sys.argv[1] input_pipeline= sys.argv[2]
params = json.load(open(input_json_path, "r"))
def writemg(): _str = "\nMeasureGranularity:[module_num:%d|svn_version:\\'Unknown\\'|variable_revision_number:3|show_window:False|notes:\\x5B\\'PARAMS\\x3A\\', \\'- Radius\\', \'- Range\\'\\x5D|batch_state:array(\\x5B\\x5D, dtype=uint8)|enabled:True|wants_pause:False]\n" % new_count
image_count = len(params['rpt_image'])
_str += FOURSPACES + "Image count:%d\n" % image_count
for img in params['rpt_image']: obj_count = len(img['rpt_object'])
_str += FOURSPACES + "Object count:%d\n" % obj_count
_str += FOURSPACES + "Select an image to measure:%s\n" % img['image_to_measure']
_str += FOURSPACES + "Subsampling factor for granularity measurements:%s\n" % img['subsampling_factor_granularity']
_str += FOURSPACES + "Subsampling factor for background reduction:%.2f\n" % img['subsampling_factor_background_reduction']
_str += FOURSPACES + "Radius of structuring element:%d\n" % img['radius'] _str += FOURSPACES + "Range of the granular spectrum:%d\n" % img['range_granular_spectrum']
for obj in img['rpt_object']: _str += FOURSPACES + "Select objects to meausre:%s\n" % obj['object_to_measure']
return _str
with open(input_pipeline) as fin: lines = fin.readlines()
k, v = lines[4].strip().split(':')
module_count = int(v) new_count = module_count + 1 lines[4] = k + ":%d\n" % new_count with open("output.cppipe", "w") as f: f.writelines(lines) f.write(writemg())
f.close()

param.name: image_to_measure
param.label: Enter the name of a greyscale image to measure

param.name: subsampling_factor_granularity
param.label: Subsampling factor for granularity measurements
param.help: A factor lower than 1 if the textures of interest are larger than a few pixels. A factor greater than 1 might increase the accuracy but also require more processing time. Images are typically of higher resolution than is required for granularity measurements, so the default value is 0.25.

param.name: subsampling_factor_background_reduction
param.label: Subsampling factor for background reduction
param.help: A small factor should be used if the structures of interest are large.

param.name: radius
param.label: Radius of structuring element
param.help: This radius should correspond to the radius of the textures of interest after subsampling.

param.name: range_granular_spectrum
param.label: Range of the granular spectrum
param.help: You may need a trial run to see which granular spectrum range yields informative measurements. Start by using a wide spectrum and narrow it down to the informative range to save time.

param.name: object_to_measure
param.label: Enter the name of the object whose granularity will be measured
param.help: You can select objects from prior modules that identify objects, such as IdentifyPrimaryObjects. If you only want to measure the granularity for the image overall, you can remove all objects.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Image granularity is a texture measurement that tries to fit a series of structure elements of increasing size into the texture of the image and outputs a spectrum of measures based on how well they fit. Granularity is measured as described by Ilya Ravkin (in the paper *Bit representation techniques and image processing*). The size of the starting structure element as well as the range of the spectrum is given as input.
